name: Adobe Binary Screen Font File
summary: Binary encoding of Adobe's character bitmap distribution formation, which is an ASCII text-encoded font format; each ABF file consists of a sequence of 8-bit bytes; character bitmaps are stored in a "strike" format, which is a rectangular pixel array; the height of the rectangle is the height of the tallest character in the font and the width is the sum of all the character widths.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.

windows.display_name: Used by programs that access system fonts

macos.display_name: Used by programs that access system fonts
